content: Calculate the perimeter of a rectangle with dimensions 6m by 12m.

To calculate the perimeter of a rectangle, you use the formula:

\[ \text{Perimeter} = 2 \times (\text{length} + \text{width}) \]

For a rectangle with a length of 12 meters and a width of 6 meters:

\[ \text{Perimeter} = 2 \times (12\, \text{m} + 6\, \text{m}) = 2 \times 18\, \text{m} = 36\, \text{m} \]

So, the perimeter of the rectangle is 36 meters.
